solution_line_template: Christian just mowed {yards_mowed_christian} yards at ${charge_per_yard} each so he made {yards_mowed_christian}*{charge_per_yard} = $<<{yards_mowed_christian}*{charge_per_yard}={christian_earnings_mowing}>>{christian_earnings_mowing}
Sue just walked {dogs_walked_sue} dogs at ${charge_per_dog} each so she made {dogs_walked_sue}*{charge_per_dog} = $<<{dogs_walked_sue}*{charge_per_dog}={sue_earnings_walking}>>{sue_earnings_walking}

Christian had ${christian_saved} saved and just made ${christian_earnings_mowing} while Sue had ${sue_saved} saved and just made ${sue_earnings_walking} so together they had {christian_saved}+{christian_earnings_mowing}+{sue_saved}+{sue_earnings_walking} = $<<{christian_saved}+{christian_earnings_mowing}+{sue_saved}+{sue_earnings_walking}={total_money_combined}>>{total_money_combined}

The perfume cost ${perfume_cost} and they had ${total_money_combined} so they needed to make {perfume_cost}-{total_money_combined} = $<<{perfume_cost}-{total_money_combined}={money_needed}>>{money_needed} more dollars
